Build a consumer brand, that's the trick; features are often commoditized. (Twitter, Fb, FriendFeed.. all gravitating toward the middle)
B2C software is often the exact opposite. Consumers are attracted to highly tuned services that require minimal thought & effort.
B2B software is like Japanese electronics, features are prioritized over usability. Employees don't mind, they are paid to learn.
B2C also tends to be extremely demoralizing at times, with consumers everyone's a critic (the vocal minority can steer you wrong).
i don't care about how successful you were in <B2B company>, B2C is a whole different ball game.
@behaviorology likewise, thanks for yalls time this morning.
